<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Given an expression for the (constant) alignment, AlignSCEV, and an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// expression for the displacement between a pointer and the aligned address,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// DiffSCEV, compute the alignment of the displaced pointer if it can be reduced</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to a constant. Using SCEV to compute alignment handles the case where</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// DiffSCEV is a recurrence with constant start such that the aligned offset</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is constant. e.g. &#123;16,+,32&#125; % 32 -&gt; 16</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the displacement is an exact multiple of the alignment, then the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// displaced pointer has the same alignment as the aligned pointer, so</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// return the alignment value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!DiffUnits)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;SCEVConstant&gt;</a>(AlignSCEV)-&gt;getValue()-&gt;getAlignValue();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the displacement is not an exact multiple, but the remainder is a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// constant, then return this remainder (but only if it is a power of 2).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="normal">    uint64&#95;t DiffUnitsAbs = std::abs(DiffUnits);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a434f6a0d80fb13e4326e848a6391f057">isPowerOf2&#95;64</a>(DiffUnitsAbs))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a>(DiffUnitsAbs);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::nullopt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There is an address given by an offset OffSCEV from AASCEV which has an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// alignment AlignSCEV. Use that information, if possible, to compute a new</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// On 32-bit platforms, DiffSCEV might now have type i32 -- we&#39;ve always</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="normal">  DiffSCEV = SE-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a38c440751f1bf5f19bc12b95f8f0f2a6">getNoopOrSignExtend</a>(DiffSCEV, OffSCEV-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#aefeda9454a5e8dfcec3deb106964832a">getType</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// What we really want to know is the overall offset to the aligned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevaddrecexpr">SCEVAddRecExpr</a> &#42;DiffARSCEV = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;SCEVAddRecExpr&gt;</a>(DiffSCEV)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The relative offset to the alignment assumption did not yield a constant,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// but we should try harder: if we assume that a is 32-byte aligned, then in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for (i = 0; i &lt; 1024; i += 4) r += a&#91;i&#93;; not all of the loads from a are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 32-byte aligned, but instead alternate between 32 and 16-byte alignment.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// As a result, the new alignment will not be a constant, but can still</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// be improved over the default (of 4) to 16</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;DiffStartSCEV = DiffARSCEV-&gt;getStart();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;DiffIncSCEV = DiffARSCEV-&gt;getStepRecurrence(&#42;SE);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;\\ttrying start/inc alignment using start &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal">                      &lt;&lt; &#42;DiffStartSCEV &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot; and inc &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;&lt; &#42;DiffIncSCEV &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;\\n&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Now compute the new alignment using the displacement to the value in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// first iteration, and also the alignment using the per-iteration delta.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If these are the same, then use that answer. Otherwise, use the smaller</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// one, but only if it divides the larger one.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
